author: Michael Larabel
description: Last month the Alliance for Open Media "AOMedia" began teasing that the AV2 video codec will release later this year. They have now sent us word that later this month will be a virtual event talking more about this successor to AV1...
title: AOMedia Will Be Talking More About The AV2 Video Codec Later This Month

author: Michael Larabel
description: Last week the block subsystem and IO_uring updates were merged for the Linux 6.18 kernel with a few items to draw attention to...
title: Linux 6.18 Block Code Introduces Lockless Bitmap For Software RAID

author: Michael Larabel
description: In addition to the Linux 6.18 kernel bringing initial bindings for writing Rust USB drivers, the main USB/Thunderbolt subsystem updates for Linux 6.18 brought a variety of other enhancements...
title: Linux 6.18 USB Brings Intel USBIO Drivers, Offload Improvements

author: Michael Larabel
description: Last week System76 released the Pop!_OS 24.04 beta along with the beta COSMIC desktop. This long overdue update to Pop!_OS re-bases against the Ubuntu 24.04 LTS base while featuring their modern, Rust-based desktop environment. For those curious I ran some benchmarks of Pop!_OS 24.04 beta compared to the current Pop!_OS 22.04 stable release.
title: System76 Pop!_OS 24.04 Beta Performing Well In Early Benchmarks

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following last week's RISC-V pull request that brought support for the MIPS Vendor Extensions and other changes plus separately the SoC pull that added mainline ESWIN EIC7700 SoC support and the HiFive Premier P550, a secondary round of RISC-V architecture updates was submitted for the Linux 6.18 merge window...
title: Linux 6.18 RISC-V Default Kernel Builds To Support Front Panel Shutdown/Reboot Buttons

author: Michael Larabel
description: Beta builds of the Blender 5.0 3D modeling software are now available ahead of the planned stable release in mid-November...
title: Blender 5.0 Beta Builds Available Ahead Of Next Month's Official Release

author: Michael Larabel
description: Tvrtko Ursulin of Igalia has been leading the work on developing a "fair" DRM scheduler for Linux kernel graphics drivers. This scheduling algorithm is inspired by CFS and aims to improve the experience of running interactive graphical clients in parallel with heavy GPU workloads. This scheduler is inching closer to being ready for the mainline Linux kernel...
title: Linux Fair DRM Scheduler Graduates Out Of The "RFC" Phase

author: Michael Larabel
description: The GNU Compiler Collection will be shifting to its "stage three" development in November as focusing more on bug fixing now and new ports and less on existing compiler functionality/features...
title: GCC 16 Compiler Shifting To "Stage 3" Development Next Month

author: Michael Larabel
description: In recent days there have been two rounds of Kernel-based Virtual Machine "KVM" feature updates to be merged for Linux 6.18 in enhancing the open-source virtualization stack...
title: KVM Virtualization Sees Several Exciting Improvements For AMD & Intel In Linux 6.18

author: Michael Larabel
description: In addition to the NTFS3 driver changes to land last week for the Linux 6.18 kernel, the exFAT file-system driver for that other Microsoft file-system has also seen some notable updates this cycle...
title: Linux 6.18 exFAT Driver Lands An Enticing Optimization
